intro: Richella hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan richella, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Richella hainanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
